<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Eat Fortune](/Feats.aspx?ID=1315) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Tengu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=240" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 26 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Frequency**
once per day

**Trigger**
A creature within 60 feet uses a [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76) or [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) effect.

</column>

---

As someone tries to twist fate, you consume the interference. The triggering effect is disrupted. If it's a misfortune effect, Eat Fortune gains the fortune trait; if it's a fortune effect, Eat Fortune gains the misfortune trait. This fortune or misfortune applies to the same roll the triggering effect would have, so you couldn't negate a fortune effect with Eat Fortune and then apply a misfortune effect to the same roll.

<title level="2">Eat Fortune leads to...</title>
[Jinx Glutton](/Feats.aspx?ID=2443)
name: Eat Fortune
